# Task

Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.



# Special Instructions

None.

Here's the solution written in Julia language:

```julia
using DataFrames, Dates

function add_yearmonth(df::DataFrame)
    df[:ym] = [Dates.year(dt)*100 + Dates.month(dt) for dt in df[:dt]]
end
```

This function will take a DataFrame `df` and it will iterate over all rows of the column `:dt`. For each row, it will get the year and month from the datetime and concatenate them together as an integer. The result is stored in new column `:ym`. This solution assumes that all values in the `:dt` column are DateTime type and it is always accurate to add 100 times the year value and add the month value for getting the year-month format. If this assumption does not hold, adjustments might be needed.
